title: How to Make Slime Without Borax

steps.title: Add 1 cup (250ml) of water to a small saucepan.
steps.content: Add 1 cup (250ml) of water to a small saucepan. Heat until the water is warm but not hot or boiling. You do not want to use boiling water because then you will have to wait for it to cool before you can use your hands to mix the slime. You can also pour the water into a microwave-safe bowl and place it in the microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute to heat up the water.

steps.title: Pour the cup of the warm water into a bowl.
steps.content: Pour the cup of the warm water into a bowl. Add three to four drops of food coloring until the water is about a shade darker than you want the slime to be. When you make the slime, the color will be diluted slightly. Mix the water well with a spoon.

steps.title: Measure 2 cups (140g/500ml) of cornstarch.
steps.content: Measure 2 cups (140g/500ml) of cornstarch. Cornstarch is known as cornflour in the UK and elsewhere. Place it into a separate large-sized bowl.

steps.title: Empty the colored water into the bowl with the cornstarch.
steps.content: Empty the colored water into the bowl with the cornstarch. Pour the colored water in slowly. Use your fingers to mix the ingredients together. Thoroughly blend the mixture into the consistency of a thick paste.

steps.title: Regulate the consistency of the slime.
steps.content: Regulate the consistency of the slime. You can add more cornstarch if the slime is too thin. Add more warm water from the amount remaining in the pan if the mixture is too thick. This is a matter of personal preference. Keep doing this as much as needed to obtain a mixture that is of the right slimy consistency for your needs. You should be able to put your fingers into the mixture easily. When you run your finger along the slime's surface, it should feel dry.

steps.title: Add items to the slime to make it extra fun (optional).
steps.content: Add items to the slime to make it extra fun (optional). You can use rubber worms, plastic insects or eyeballs, etc. This is a great idea for a Halloween party, a science party or for a party or camp based on nature or environmental themes.

steps.title: Place your slime into a plastic bag.
steps.content: Place your slime into a plastic bag. Seal the bag well to preserve it.

steps.title: Pour the can of sweetened condensed milk into a saucepan.
steps.content: Pour the can of sweetened condensed milk into a saucepan. You can also use a pot. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add 1 tablespoon (14 grams) of cornstarch to the sweetened condensed milk.
steps.content: Add 1 tablespoon (14 grams) of cornstarch to the sweetened condensed milk. Turn the heat on low and simmer the mixture. Stir constantly. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the mixture from the heat when it has thickened.
steps.content: Remove the mixture from the heat when it has thickened. Add the food coloring. Add as much as you need to reach your desired color. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the slime to cool.
steps.content: Allow the slime to cool. Once it has cooled, you can play with (or eat) it. Keep in mind that it might stain lighter colored clothes or carpets. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Done.
steps.content: Done.

steps.title: Pour a half a cup of PVA glue into a bowl.
steps.content: Pour a half a cup of PVA glue into a bowl.

steps.title: Add a drop or two of food coloring.
steps.content: Add a drop or two of food coloring.

steps.title: Mix well to combine and distribute the color evenly.
steps.content: Mix well to combine and distribute the color evenly.

steps.title: Add a half cup of baby powder (talc).
steps.content: Add a half cup of baby powder (talc). Add more if needed, until it reaches a slime consistency.

steps.title: Play with the slime.
steps.content: Play with the slime. Store in an airtight container.

steps.title: Mix 1 teaspoon of powdered fiber with 1 cup of water.
steps.content: Mix 1 teaspoon of powdered fiber with 1 cup of water. Be sure to do this in a microwave-safe bowl as you will be putting the mixture in the microwave later. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Add drops of food coloring until the water and fiber mixture is your desired color.
steps.content: Add drops of food coloring until the water and fiber mixture is your desired color. This will be the color of your slime. It will not be diluted later. Stir thoroughly. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Place the mixture and microwave-safe bowl in the microwave.
steps.content: Place the mixture and microwave-safe bowl in the microwave. Heat it on high for four to five minutes. Check on the mixture regularly to make sure that it does not boil over the bowl. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Let the mixture stand for two to four minutes and stir.
steps.content: Let the mixture stand for two to four minutes and stir. The mixture should be relatively cool after this amount of time. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the boiling and cooling process two to six times, stirring the mixture each time you let it cool.
steps.content: Repeat the boiling and cooling process two to six times, stirring the mixture each time you let it cool. The more times you repeat this process, the thicker your slime will be.

steps.title: Let the slime cool in the microwave.
steps.content: Let the slime cool in the microwave. Let it sit for 10 or so minutes. Make sure not to handle it before it is fully cooled as it will be very hot. [9] X Research source You can place the slime on a plate or cutting board to cool.
